title: Engine - Installation

body.body: When using lifting equipment, make sure the minimum safe working load of the lifting equipment exceeds the weight of the motorcycle it is lifting.
Equipment not suitable for lifting the motorcycle's weight may fail during operation.
Lifting equipment not suitable to support the weight of the motorcycle could fail causing personal injury.
Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall resulting in motorcycle damage, serious injury or death.
Expanding sleeves and tapered adjusters are used to align the engine to the frame.
Prior to installation the expanding sleeves and tapered adjusters must be thoroughly cleaned.
Failure to keep the expanding sleeves and tapered adjusters free of contamination during installation may cause the engine and frame to become incorrectly aligned.
Thoroughly clean the bolts, expanding sleeves and tapered sleeves.
Position the engine to the frame.
Check the routing of the harnesses and the fuel tank vent hose through the crankcase rear cable guide.
Expanding sleeves and tapered adjusters are used on the right hand side of the frame to align the engine.
The numbers in brackets in the following text refer to the frame fixing illustration below.
Do not tighten the fixings at this stage.
Insert the mounting bolt (1) for the front left hand side of the cylinder head mounting.
Insert the mounting bolt (2) for the front right hand side of the cylinder head mounting.
Insert the mounting bolt (3) for the rear left hand side of the cylinder head mounting.
Insert the mounting bolt (4) for the rear right hand side of the cylinder head mounting.
Insert the mounting bolt (5) for the lower left hand side of the crankcase mounting.
Insert the expanding sleeve (6), tapered sleeve (7) and the bolt (8) for the lower right hand side of the crankcase mounting.
Insert the mounting bolt (9) for the upper left hand side of the crankcase mounting.
Insert the expanding sleeve (10), tapered sleeve (11) and the bolt (12) for the upper right hand side of the crankcase mounting.
Remove the lock nut cover on the left hand outrigger.
Loosen the outriggers to frame lock nut.
loosen the left hand outrigger inner fixing.
Loosen the support bracket to left hand outrigger fixings.
loosen the right hand outrigger inner fixing.
Loosen the support bracket to right hand outrigger fixings.
Remove the swinging arm spindle lock nut and washer on the right hand side of the frame. Discard the lock nut.
Partially withdraw the swinging arm spindle from the left hand side, to allow access to the frame adjuster on the right hand side of the frame.
, locate the peg into the slot of the frame adjuster and loosen the frame adjuster.
Note that three of the four fixings for the rear subframe has a lock nut.
The lower left hand fixing does not have a lock nut.
Tighten the engine mounting fixings in the following two stages:
Tighten the left hand outrigger to crankcase lower mounting bolt (1) to
Tighten the left hand outrigger to crankcase upper mounting bolt (2) to
Hold the bolt (3) and tighten the outrigger lock nut (4) to
Tighten the right hand outrigger to crankcase lower mounting bolt (5) to
Tighten the right hand outrigger to crankcase upper mounting bolt (6) to
Tighten the cylinder head right hand rear mounting bolt (7) to
Tighten the cylinder head left hand rear mounting bolt (8) to
Hold the new lock nut (9) and tighten the cylinder head right hand front mounting bolt (10) to
Hold the new lock nut (9) and tighten the cylinder head left hand front mounting bolt (11) to
tighten the outriggers inner fixing to
Tighten the outriggers to engine support brackets fixings to
Tighten the engine support brackets to crankcase fixings to
The master spline on the drive shaft universal joint is indicated by a locating hole in the yoke of the universal joint.
Support the rear bevel box and align the master spline of the drive shaft to the master spline on the front bevel box.
Align the top link to the final drive or rear wheel hanger.
Fit the spacer, bolt and a new lock nut for the rear wheel hanger. Hold the lock nut and tighten the bolt to
Fit the spacer, bolt and a new lock nut for the final drive. Hold the lock nut and tighten the bolt to
Before tightening the front clamp for the front gaiter, make sure the alignment mark on the clamp molding is aligned to the arrow on the gaiter.
Fit the drive shaft front gaiter clamps as noted for removal and tighten to
Raise the rear of the motorcycle until the rear wheel is off the ground.
Partially withdraw the swinging arm spindle from the left hand side, to allow access to the frame adjuster on the right hand side of the frame.
, locate the pegs into the slot of the frame adjuster and tighten the frame adjuster to
Fit the washer and new lock nut to the swinging arm spindle. Do not fully tighten at this stage.
Tighten the left hand outrigger to crankcase lower mounting bolt (1) to
Tighten the left hand outrigger to crankcase upper mounting bolt (2) to
Hold the bolt (3) and tighten the outrigger through lock nut (4) to
Tighten the right hand outrigger to crankcase lower mounting bolt (5) to
Tighten the right hand outrigger to crankcase upper mounting bolt (6) to
Tighten the cylinder head right hand rear mounting bolt (7) to
Tighten the cylinder head left hand rear mounting bolt (8) to
Hold the nut (9) and tighten the cylinder head right hand front mounting bolt to (10)
Hold the nut (9) and tighten the cylinder head left hand front mounting bolt (11) to
Hold the new lock nuts and tighten the rear subframe fixings to
Rear Subframe Tightening Sequence (rear mudguard removed for clarity)
Hold the swinging arm spindle and tighten the new lock nut to
Position the motorcycle on its centre stand and secure.
Align the alignment marks and fit the gear change knuckle to the gear selector shaft. Tighten the pinch bolt to
Fit the gear change pedal to the out rigger and tighten the new pivot bolt to
Connect the engine ground cable and tighten the new fixing to
Fit the left hand outrigger cover (see
Fit the clutch lifter arm to the clutch lifter shaft, lining up the split line of the lifter arm with the alignment mark on the lifter shaft. Fit a new fixing and tighten to
Fit the clutch slave cylinder bracket to the clutch cover and tighten in the fixings to
Fit the ignition coils and connect the electrical connectors.
Fit the ignition coil cover and tighten the fixings to
Attach the keyless ECM connector bracket to its bracket.
Note that the chassis ECM wire guide is secured to the upper crankcase by two retaining clips and a fixing.
Fit the chassis ECM wire guide to the upper crankcase. Make sure the two retaining lugs secure the wire guide to the crankcase. Fit a new fixing and tighten to
Fit the wire guide to the breather cover and tighten the new fixings to
Connect the following engine subharness connectors:
rotational ON/OFF switch connector (US markets only).
secure the regulator/rectifier harness to the cable guide.
position the engine subharness connector into the chassis ECM wire guide, as shown in the illustration below.
Make sure the rubber shield is fitted to the chassis ECM unit bracket.
Secure the fuel tank drain hose to the chassis ECM unit bracket.
Fit the chassis ECM unit bracket and tighten its new fixings to
Position the foam pad on to the chassis ECM unit bracket.
Connect the secondary air injection valve electrical connector.
Fit a cable tie for the main harness to the right hand side of seat bridge.
Fit the seat bridge to the frame with the original washers and new fixings. Tighten the fixings to
Secure the main harness to the seat bridge with the cable tie.
Attach the battery negative cable and the two brake lines to the left hand side of the seat bridge as noted for removal.
Attach the evaporative canister to the lower bracket.
Secure the radiator to the lower bracket and tighten the fixing to
Secure the lower bracket to the radiator duct and tighten the fixing to
Attach the vent hose to the evaporative cannister.
Fit the coolant hose to the radiator outlet and secure with its clamp.
Fit the coolant bypass hose to the radiator and secure with its clamp.
Connect both electrical connectors to the regulator/rectifier, make sure the locking tab is fully inserted.
Fit the cover to the regulator/rectifier.
Route the starter motor cable as noted for removal. Attach the P-clips to the sump and tighten the fixings to
Fit the starter cable to its connection pole and tighten the nut to
Fit the starter motor cover. Tighten the two new lower fixings to
Fit the sump guard front bracket to the sump and tighten the fixings to

body.name: Sump guard bracket rear fixings B02336

body.body: Fit the fixing securing the sump guard front bracket to the lower crankcase and tighten to
If required, fill the engine with the correct grade of engine oil (see
Sump guard installation PR1; PRB; PRC; PS1; PSB; PSC; PWC; PX1; PXB; PXC; PY1; PYB; PYC
